thread.title: Falcons' Julio Jones: 'I’m practicing the whole week' before Super Bowl LI
thread.title_full: Falcons' Julio Jones: 'I’m practicing the whole week' before Super Bowl LI

author: Tom Pelissero
title: Falcons' Julio Jones: 'I’m practicing the whole week' before Super Bowl LI
text:
Let friends in your social network know what you are reading about Facebook Email Falcons' Julio Jones: 'I’m practicing the whole week' before Super Bowl LI Falcons all-pro receiver expects no setbacks from toe injury. Post to Facebook Falcons' Julio Jones: 'I’m practicing the whole week' before Super Bowl LI Falcons all-pro receiver expects no setbacks from toe injury. Check out this story on USATODAY.com: http://usat.ly/2jXykNF Cancel Send A link has been sent to your friend's email address. Posted! A link has been posted to your Facebook feed. Join the Nation's Conversation To find out more about Facebook commenting please read the Conversation Guidelines and FAQs Falcons' Julio Jones: 'I’m practicing the whole week' before Super Bowl LI Tom Pelissero , USA TODAY Sports 10:36 a.m. ET Feb. 1, 2017 CLOSE x Share USA TODAY Sports' Tom Pelissero breaks down what to look out for from Houston as the New England Patriots and Atlanta Falcons prepare for Super Bowl LI. USA TODAY Sports Falcons WR Julio Jones led the NFL in 2016 with more than 100 receiving yards per game. (Photo: Matthew Emmons, USA TODAY Sports) 
HOUSTON — Atlanta Falcons star receiver Julio Jones says he and his troublesome toe will be full-go as preparations continue for Super Bowl LI. 
“I’m practicing the whole week,” Jones told reporters Wednesday. 
Jones barely practiced in the lead-up to the Jan. 22 NFC Championship Game but nonetheless had a monster game — nine catches for 180 yards and two touchdowns, including a 73-yard score — in the Falcons’ 44-21 rout of the Green Bay Packers. The ultimate Super Bowl LI preview: How do Patriots, Falcons stack up? 
He missed two games with a sprained toe on his left foot in December, then aggravated the injury in Atlanta’s divisional playoff win over the Seattle Seahawks. He got some limited work last week before the Falcons left for Houston and dismissed the toe as a nonissue. 
“I feel great,” Jones said. 
*** 
Follow Tom Pelissero on Twitter @TomPelissero 
PHOTOS: Falcons' road to Super Bowl LI Facebook Posted! A link has been posted to your Facebook feed. Week 1: Atlanta stumbled out of the gates with a 31-24 loss to the Tampa Bay Buccaneers. The Falcons couldn't keep up with Jameis Winston, who threw for 284 yards and four touchdowns. Jason Getz, USA TODAY Sports Week 2: The Falcons outlasted the Oakland Raiders in a wild one thanks to Taylor Gabriel's 8-yard touchdown catch on a tipped pass. Atlanta's defense held on a fourth-and-2 run to help wrap up the first win of the year. Cary Edmondson, USA TODAY Sports Week 3: The depth of the Falcons' offense began to show in a 45-23 win over the New Orleans Saints. Running back Tevin Coleman scored three touchdowns, while Devonta Freeman had 207 yards from scrimmage. Derick E. Hingle, USA TODAY Sports Fullscreen Week 4: Julio Jones and Matt Ryan both exploded for record days in Atlanta's 48-33 win over the defending NFC-champion Carolina Panthers. Jones finished with a franchise-record 300 receiving yards on 12 catches, falling just short of the NFL record of 336, while Ryan's 503 passing yards were also a team best. Jason Getz, USA TODAY Sports Fullscreen Week 5: Atlanta handed the defending Super Bowl-champion Denver Broncos their first loss despite a less explosive output from its offense. The Falcons rattled rookie Paxton Lynch, who was making his first start at QB for the Broncos, and relied on a steady output from its running backs to seal the win. Ron Chenoy, USA TODAY Sports Fullscreen Week 6: Dan Quinn's return to Seattle ended in disappointment as the Falcons fell 26-24 to the Seahawks amid controversy. Richard Sherman appeared to interfere with Julio Jones on a deep fourth-and-10 pass in the final two minutes, but officials did not call a penalty. Joe Nicholson, USA TODAY Sports Week 7: A wild comeback left the Falcons stunned in a 33-30 overtime loss to the San Diego Chargers. Atlanta held at 27-10 lead but couldn't hold on, and Josh Lambo kicked the game-winning field goal in overtime. Dale Zanine, USA TODAY Sports Week 8: A 33-32 last-second win over the Green Bay Packers broke Atlanta out of its two-game slide. Mohamed Sanu's 11-yard touchdown catch in the final minute gave the Falcons the final edge. Brett Davis, USA TODAY Sports Week 9: Atlanta avenged its season-opening loss to the Tampa Bay Buccaneers with a 43-28 triumph in the rematch. Matt Ryan threw for 344 yards and four touchdowns to help the Falcons extend their NFC South lead. Reinhold Matay, USA TODAY Sports Week 10: The Falcons entered their bye week on a sour note after tripping in a 24-15 loss to the Philadelphia Eagles. Ryan Mathews ran for two touchdowns and the Falcons had to settle for three field goals. Eric Hartline, USA TODAY Sports Week 12: Taylor Gabriel emerged as the Falcons' newest weapon in a 38-19 win over the Arizona Cardinals. The diminutive receiver and free agent pickup took two short passes for touchdowns and had four receptions for 75 yards. Jason Getz, USA TODAY Sports Fullscreen Week 13: Eric Berry proved to be a worthy foe for the Falcons, as the Kansas City Chiefs escaped with a 29-28 win. Berry returned one interception and became the first player to return a two-point conversion for a score to seal Kansas City's win. Jason Getz, USA TODAY Sports Fullscreen Week 14: Atlanta's defense got in on the scoring in a 42-14 rout of the Los Angeles Rams. Deion Jones returned an interception for a touchdown, and Vic Beasley forced a Jared Goff fumble that he scooped up for a score. Jayne Kamin-Oncea, USA TODAY Sports Week 15: Devonta Freeman took control in the Falcons' 41-13 win over the San Francisco 49ers. Freeman ran for 139 rushing yards and three touchdowns in the romp. Dale Zanine, USA TODAY Sports Week 16: A balanced offensive effort helped the Falcons ease past the Carolina Panthers in a 33-16 win. Atlanta intercepted Cam Newton twice and held him to 198 yards. Bob Donnan, USA TODAY Sports Week 17: The Falcons put the finishing touches on their NFC South title with a 38-32 win over the New Orleans Saints. Atlanta clinched the No. 2 seed in the NFC and a first-round bye with the win. Jason Getz, USA TODAY Sports Fullscreen Divisional round: The Falcons didn't leave their playoff fate to another late call, as they rolled past the Seattle Seahawks for a 36-20 win. Matt Ryan threw for 338 yards and three touchdowns, while the defense threw off Russell Wilson and Seattle's attack. Jason Getz, USA TODAY Sports Fullscreen NFC Championship Game: Atlanta sealed just its second-ever trip to the Super Bowl with a 44-21 thrashing of the Green Bay Packers. The Falcons' red-hot offense racked up 493 yards, and Aaron Rodgers was held in check after a wild late-season run. Jason Getz, USA TODAY Sports Like this topic? You may also like these photo galleries: Replay
